snippet: A week after Hurricane Sandy lashed the region, the city ordered a halt to construction work and parks and playgrounds closed as a second storm closed in.
abstract: New York City officials are mobilizing for a northeaster that threatens to deliver more brutal winds and wet snow in places where frustrations continue to run high after Hurricane Sandy; more than 600 residents of three nursing homes and an adult care center in the Rockaways, in Queens, are being evacuated; city also orders construction work halted and parks and playgrounds closed.
lead_paragraph: A week after Hurricane Sandy lashed the region, the city ordered a halt to construction work and parks and playgrounds closed as a second storm closed in.

headline.seo: Officials Brace as Northeaster Threatens the New York Area
